content: one skein thick & quick crochet scarves since the beginning of october i ve taught a few knitting and crochet classes to the dozen or so new yarnies out there hello i hope you re all enjoying winter s lure to stitch up warm things also in october i hooked up a couple of beginner scarves - the staple first project for my crochet classes they also make nice quick gifts under an hour if you re fast and if you re a coupon-slinging shopper one ball of this yarn will cost less than $5 dimensions long & skinny 4 x 76 10 x 190 cm thick & warm 5 x 60 13 x 152 cm you ll need 1 ball of lion brand wool ease thick-n-quick for each scarf 108 yds / 99 m size p/16 11 5 mm crochet hook gauge 5 double_crochet x 4 row 4 x 4 10 x 10 cm directions chain 98 78 very loosely leaving 4 to 6 10 to 15 cm tail as fringe working into the back loop of each chain double_crochet in 4th chain from the hook and in each chain across including turning skipped chain s you will have 96 76 double_crochet s turn chain 3 counts as 1st double_crochet skipping first double_crochet double_crochet in next and in each double_crochet across 96 76 double_crochet s repeat previous row 2 3 times more for a total of 4 5 row then fasten_off leaving tail as long as fringe to make fringe cut yarn into 20 24 equal strands or twice the length of desired fringe use 2 strands for each fringe point - at the beginning and end of the first and last row and in between each middle row posted by meilynne at october 30 2008 9 40 pm
